sub_topic: Preparation of acetylsalicylic acid from acetic anhydride and salicylic acid
message_1: What is the yield of acetylsalicylic acid produced when 5 grams of salicylic acid is reacted with excess acetic anhydride, assuming a theoretical yield of 7 grams and an actual yield of 4.5 grams?
message_2:
To calculate the percent yield of acetylsalicylic acid, we can use the formula:

Percent Yield = (Actual Yield / Theoretical Yield) × 100

Given the actual yield is 4.5 grams and the theoretical yield is 7 grams, we can plug these values into the formula:

Percent Yield = (4.5 grams / 7 grams) × 100

Percent Yield = 0.642857 × 100

Percent Yield ≈ 64.29%

The yield of acetylsalicylic acid produced in this reaction is approximately 64.29%.
